initial_comment.comment: Does anyone know how to display JSON data in the format shown above?

text: what do you mean? how to represent the format above in JSON?
list with names of stations and times?
I  think he mean by how to make the UI shown in image
would be easy enough with a list/recyclerview for the body, and a textview for the header

in a vertical linear layout, with the recyclerview set to `android:layout_width=“match_parent” android:layout_height=“0dp” android:layout_weight=“1”`… where the header textview has `android:layout_width=“match_parent” android:layout_height=“wrap_content”`
(assuming you want the header to stay put as you scroll)
you can check this Timeline View Library <https://github.com/vipulasri/Timeline-View>

attachments.title: vipulasri/Timeline-View
attachments.text: Timeline-View - Android Timeline View is used to display views like Tracking of shipment/order, steppers etc.

text: <@U1BQM2E4X|skennedy> has joined the channel
<@U1BQXBNLW|jdlothar> has joined the channel
<@U0XJ96KPG>: there are tons of ways to implement a chat app. Best to keep an open socket for incoming and outgoing messages instead of having a REST API or something.
But then again, it's better to look at some professional chat advice. I never made a professional chat app that can scale.
But doing a REST API call every single message is costly for a single message every single time.
I’d use an off the shelf solution, esp if your app is not primarily chat.
layer, applozic, there’s a bunch out there
